translateItemList.eng: Attacks damage all enemy minions.

A fearsome practitioner of the astral and arcane arts, Archmagus Vol once tricked Zane into betraying his fellow allies. With reckless abandon Zane will stop at nothing to avenge his fallen brethren even if it means sacrificing his own life.  You must not let this fight be his last.
Darkspear Zane
Zane has a mind of his own. Deals double damage to Vol. Zane dies if his attack exceeds 6. Your general dies if Zane dies.
Taskmaster Beatrix

Cannot be targeted by spells.
Generals cannot move.
All minions summoned act like Battle Pets.

A master of strange toxins and paralyzing venoms makes Taskmaster Beatrix a terrifying force to reckon with.  Covering the battlefield in maddening aromas, she brings out uncontrollable behavior for all but the strongest.  Those who can resist going mad end up nearly paralyzed, leaving them at the mercy of the combatants.
Grym the Vengeful
Whenever a friendly minion dies, deal 3 damage to a random minion and restore 3 health.

After having fallen in battle to an Abyssian priestess, the rogue Magmar Grym was cursed to be reborn with corrupted flesh and an unquenchable hunger for death.  Uncaring of the lives of others he feeds on both friend and foe alike to feed his rage.
Nahlgol
At the start of your turn spawn an Exhuming Sand tile randomly on the board.

Once guardian to a long dead king, Nahlgol was reanimated by a necromancer who sought to use him for his own gain.  Gazing upon this necromancer, Nahlgol immediately drew his sword and slew him without hesitation, with it gaining the power to summon the spirits of his forgotten kingsguard.  Nahlgol now forever wanders the Akram desert in search of his fallen king.
Wolfpunch

Celerity
Has +4 attack on opponent's turn. At the start of your turn, spawn a Fox Ravager.

Surviving the harsh winters of the Northern Whyte Mountains is an uncommon feat. Few grow stronger and fewer still revel in the sheer ferocity of nature. While some call upon animal spirits to survive, Wolfpunch instead becomes a beast of his own design, brutalizing any unfortunate enough to cross his path.
Unhallowed
Whenever this takes damage, spawn a random Haunt nearby.

The Unhallowed has risen from the grave with a dark design to curse all of Mythron.  Not all of her tricks are devious though.  If luck is on your side, some of her twisted malcontents might even hold a treat.
Candy Panda

Sentinel: General attacks.
Treat! Restore 5 health to the attacking General and draw a card.
Cannot attack Generals.

Sentinel: Minion summoned.
Treat! Give the minion that transformed this +2/+2 and draw a card.
Cannot attack Generals.

Sentinel: Spell cast.
Treat! Refund the mana for the spell that was cast and draw a card.
Cannot attack Generals.
Corporeal Haunt

The enemy General's minions cost 1 more to play.
Dying Wish: Draw 2 cards
Enchanted Haunt

The enemy General's non-Bloodbound spells cost 1 more to cast.
Dying Wish: Draw 2 cards
Material Haunt

The enemy General's artifacts cost 1 more to play.
Dying Wish: Draw 2 cards
Santaur the Terrible
At the start of Santaur's turn, spawn a Frostfire Elf nearby

Normally a cave dweller, Santaur the Terrible emerges once a year with his elves to distribute presents to the people of Mythron. This would normally be a cause for celebration if he didn't always beat the recipient to death after giving them their gifts.
Frostfire Elf

Celerity
Dying Wish: Give the player a Holiday Gift
Jingle Bells
Your General gains Flying.
Lump of Coal
Your Bloodbound Spell cannot be cast.
Mistletoe
Cards in your hand cost 1 less to play.
Snowball
Your General gains Ranged and -1 Attack.
Holiday Gift
Equip a random present.
Legion

All Legion restore 3 health at the end of turn.
All killed Legion respawn in a corner at the start of turn.
A being not quite machine, not quite organic, Legion can divide its strengths amongst multiple clones of itself.

All Legion gain +2 Attack.
All killed Legion respawn in a corner at the start of turn.

All Legion can move 2 extra spaces.
All killed Legion respawn in a corner at the start of turn.

All Legion cannot be targeted by spells.
All killed Legion respawn in a corner at the start of turn.
Harmony
All minions cost 0 mana.
A paragon of order and unity.  Those in its presence are blessed with a deeper connection to all life.  When Harmony falls Dissonance rises.
Dissonance

Frenzy
When Dissonance is spawned all minions switch allegiances and Dissonance gains +3/+3 for each of its minions that switched sides.
Andromeda

Flying
Whenever the enemy General plays a minion, transform it into a random minion with the same mana cost.
A sorceress able to transcend time and space, Andromeda can bend the very fabric of reality.  She alone holds the secrets to life, the universe, and everything.
The Invader
At the start of your turn, deal 6 damage to a random minion or General.

The city of Kaero is under attack from an alien invader. The only way to save the city is to pilot an experimental new mech, the Protector. Save as many lives as you can, for every building that falls, the invader grows in power.
Protector
Whenever an enemy minion dies, this gains attack equal to that minion's attack.
Kaero Tower
When this dies, The Invader gains +2/+6
Soulstealer
Whenever the enemy General plays a minion, it becomes their new General.  Whenever Soulstealer dies, he inhabits the body of one of his minions.

Historians have spoke of a demon who haunts the Echoing Depths. While not much is known about it, there are some who claim that they returned from the Echoing Depths in a different body than the one they entered with.
Kahlmar the Spell Eater
Whenever the enemy casts a spell, gain a random keyword.  Whenever any minion is summoned it gains the keywords of its General.

An accomplished mage by any account, Kahlmar is known the world over for being an accomplished assassin of magic practitioners. Earning the nickname 'Spell Eater', Kahlmar possesses a unique talent for absorbing the spells cast against him and using them to grow stronger.
